page.title: 06A BUS DRIVER IN BURTON
page.content:
Page 2 (of 2)
The basic week is 39 hours, but the drivers work 52 or 53 hours a week. Basic pay is just over 2.26 pounds an hour,with a bonus of 23.19 pounds for one-man operation. Other bonuses bring pay to around 140 pounds a week. Mr. Ireland drives up to 10 hours in a shift which can be spread over 16 hours,although the law insists on a rest after 5.5 hours,so his working day could stretch from 7 a.m to 11 p.m. In the 10 minutes before and after duty the bus has to be checked. After about 3 weeks training drivers go on the road in an ESDC bus,usually made by Leyland, Daimler or Dennis, with a maximum speed of 40mph,using engines of around 160 brake horse power to carry up to 78 people about Burton.
